tool_description: Access Worldwide Flight Schedules with connection building.
name: TimeTable Lookup
title: TimeTable Lookup

api_list.name: codes - Entertainment Codes
api_list.description: Return a list of entertainment codes used by the airlines
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://timetable-lookup.p.rapidapi.com/codes/entertainment/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "timetable-lookup.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://timetable-lookup.p.rapidapi.com/codes/entertainment/"

api_list.name: Flight Schedules
api_list.description: FlightLookup Web Services, powered by FlightLookup Routing Engine.  This API provides a powerful information source for developing sophisticated applications requiring flight related schedule data.  Whether you are a software company developing products for sale or an in-house developer, the FlightLookup Web Services APIs are unmatched in terms of breadth and richness of information. Our development tools and documentation will get you up to speed quickly enabling short development cycles.

required_parameters.name: From
required_parameters.description: 3 letter IATA code for the departure airport

required_parameters.name: To
required_parameters.description: 3 letter IATA code for the destination airport

optional_parameters.name: Time
optional_parameters.description: Return flights that happen during the specified time period (ANY, AM, PM, NIGHT)

optional_parameters.name: Compression
optional_parameters.description: Displays non-stops, directs and logical single and multiple connections up to the maximum number of results requested (AUTO, NONSTOP, DIRECT, 1STOP, MORE)

optional_parameters.name: 7Day
optional_parameters.description: Setting to "N" results in 1 days of results. Setting to "Y" results in 7 days of results. (N, Y)

optional_parameters.name: Results
optional_parameters.description: Range = 1 to 500, Maximum number of results to return

optional_parameters.name: Connection
optional_parameters.description: Displays non-stops, directs and logical single and multiple connections up to the maximum number of results requested

optional_parameters.name: Sort
optional_parameters.description: Specify the sort order for the results (Departure, Optional - Arrival, Duration, Flights)

optional_parameters.name: MaxConnect
optional_parameters.description: Range = 120-1200. Maximum time between flight in minutes. Default = 240 which is the IATA standard.

optional_parameters.name: Airline
optional_parameters.description: Restrict by specific airline 2 or 3 letter airline IATA code

optional_parameters.name: FlightNumber
optional_parameters.description: Restrict by specific flight number must be used with Airline

optional_parameters.name: ExpandResults
optional_parameters.description: Y = Override the flight efficiency filter, showing more results. N = Do not override the flight efficiency filter, showing fewer results.

api_list.name: airports - Nonstop routes for an airport by airline
api_list.description: Returns a list of nonstop routes for an airport restricted to an airline

test_endpoint.messages: The request to the API has timed out. Please try again later, or if the issue persists, please contact the API provider
test_endpoint.info: Your Client (working) ---> Gateway (working) ---> API (took too long to respond)

api_list.name: airlines - Airports in a country an airline operates in
api_list.description: Return a list of airports in a country an airline operates in

api_list.name: airlines - Countries airline operates in
api_list.description: Return a list of the countries that an airline operates in
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://timetable-lookup.p.rapidapi.com/airlines/wn/countries/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "timetable-lookup.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://timetable-lookup.p.rapidapi.com/airlines/{airlineiatacode}/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "timetable-lookup.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
